page.title: 02Gravel Workings,Bubbenhall
page.content: The sand and gravel pits are located in Bubbenhall.Consolidated Gold operate the land which is owned by John Charllote.He is paid royalties for letting them use his land;for every tonne that is sold he receives so much money.The sand and gravel extracted is used for cement and concrete.The company started on this site in 1980.When all of the sand and gravel have been removed,Warwickshire County Council fill in the holes with rubbish from Leamington Spa and Rugby. This is known as "Landfill".It will then be covered over with the top soil so that it can be used for farming once again.Excavtions have revealed fossils of Mammoth teeth dating from the Pleistocene era.These sand and gravel workings form a chain across central Warks and were the outwash of the Glacial period.
